summary: the coronavirus hemagglutinating encephalomyelitis virus (PHE-CoV) infects mainly piglets under the age of 3 weeks and causes vomiting, exhaustion, and obvious neurological symptoms. the mortality rate ranges from 20 to 100% (11) in 1962, the pathogen was isolated from suckling pigs suffering from encephalomyelitis in Canada. the natural host of PHE-CoV is the pig, but the virus has been adapted experimentally for replication in mice and Wistar rats. the virus is neurotropic in mice, but susceptibility was found to be influenced by age and the route of inoculation. pig industry cannot ignore the potential hazards of PHE. development of a PHE-CoV vaccine to control PHE-CoV infection will be economically and medically significant. the viruses were propagated by passage in porcine kidney epithelial cells (PK-15 cells) (9), purified by sucrose density gradient centrifugation, and stored at 80°C until use. the inactivated virus was then diluted in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and was mixed with Alhydrogel diluted 9:1 according to the reference protocol in “the Veterinary Biological Products Quality Standard in China”. RT-PCR was performed in a total reaction volume of 25 l using the One-Step RT-PCR kit (TaKaRa, Dalian, China) PCR was performed with an initial denaturation at 96°C for 5 min, followed by 30 cycles at 95°C for 50 s, 50°C for 50 s, and 72°C for 2 min. the gene fragment was recovered from pTS1 by double-enzyme cleavage using EcoRI/ the gene was amplified from PHE-CoV genomic RNA and was subcloned into pVAX1 to construct recombinant plasmid pVAX1-S1. group 1 consisted of mice (10 per vaccine group) that were immunized at 0, 2, and 4 weeks, sacrificed at 6 weeks. the virus neutralization (VN) assay is a more reliable measure than the hemagglutination inhibition (HI) test for the detection of PHE-CoV infection. the serum for the VN assay was inactivated at 56°C for 30 min and was diluted with minimum essential medium (MEM) anti-mouse IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 and IgA antibodies were added to the wells, and the plates were incubated for 1 h at 37°C. after four washes with PBST, the plates were incubated with a peroxidase-conjugated anti-mouse IgG antibody (1:4,000; Sigma) 100 l of RPMI 1640 was used as a control. plates were incubated at 37°C under 5% CO2 for 48 h. 10 l of 3-(4,5-dimethyl-2-thazolyl)-2,5-diphenyl-2H-tetrazolium bromide was added to each well. ens were collected; single-cell suspensions stimulated with inactivated PHE-CoV were prepared. levels of cytokines interleukin-2 (IL-2), IL-4, tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-) and gamma interferon (IFN-) were detected by using an ELISA kit. the viruses were propagated by passage in porcine kidney epithelial cells (PK-15 cells) (9), purified by sucrose density gradient centrifugation, and stored at 80°C until use. the inactivated virus was then diluted in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) and was mixed with Alhydrogel diluted 9:1 according to the reference protocol in “the Veterinary Biological Products Quality Standard in China”. RT-PCR was performed in a total reaction volume of 25 l using the One-Step RT-PCR kit (TaKaRa, Dalian, China) PCR was performed with an initial denaturation at 96°C for 5 min, followed by 30 cycles at 95°C for 50 s, 50°C for 50 s, and 72°C for 2 min. the gene fragment was recovered from pTS1 by double-enzyme cleavage using EcoRI/ the gene was amplified from PHE-CoV genomic RNA. it was subcloned into pVAX1 to construct recombinant plasmid pVAX1-S1. mice were immunized at 0, 2, and 4 weeks, sacrificed at 6 weeks. serum for the VN assay was inactivated at 56°C for 30 min. serum was inactivated at 56°C for 30 min and was diluted with minimum medium. serum dilution inhibited cytopathic effect in 50% of the wells. anti-mouse IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 and IgA antibodies were added to the wells. the plates were incubated for 1 h at 37°C. the reaction was stopped by the addition of 2 M H2SO4 solution. 100 l of RPMI 1640 was used as a control. plates were incubated at 37°C under 5% CO2 for 48 h. the plates were incubated for another 4 h. cytokines interleukin-2 (IL-2), IL-4, tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-) and gamma interferon (IFN-) were detected by using an ELISA kit. a wash solution (300 l/well) was added for 1 min, and the plates were washed 4 times. group 1 mice vaccinated with different PHE-CoV vaccines showed detectable serum neutralizing antibody titers at 2 weeks. titers for 2S1 + IPV were higher than those for 2S1 and 2S1. antibodies in individual sera collected at 6 weeks were detected by ELISA using anti-mouse IgG1, IgG2a, IgG2b, IgG3 and IgA secondary antibodies. levels of anti-PHE-CoV IgG2a were significantly higher in mice immunized with IPV than in mice immunized with IP without alum. group 2 mice were immunized and were challenged with live PHE-CoV. mice appeared normal in activity and appetite and showed no signs of adverse reaction to any of the vaccines at the administration site. mice were deeply anesthetized and killed 1 week after challenge. vaccinated mice mounted a T-cell response against PHE-CoV. immune mice were stimulated with PHE-CoV (specific antigen) and ConA (nonspecific antigen) the OD values of the five vaccine groups showed significant differences. the percentages of CD4+ cells in mice immunized with IPV (inactivated PHE-CoV plus alum), IP (inactivated PHE-CoV alone), S1 (pVAX1-S1), 2S1 + IPV (plasmid pVAX1-S1 and inactivated PHE-CoV plus alum) increased significantly over those in mice immunized with either the PBS or the pVAX1 control (P > the ratios of CD4+ to CD8+ cells in mice immunized with vaccines were higher than those in the control groups. the percentages of CD4+ cells in mice immunized with the vaccines were significantly higher than those for mice immunized with the vaccines. cytokines (IL-2, IL-4, TNF-, and IFN-) produced by the immunized mice show significant differences between the five vaccine groups (IP, IPV, S1, 2S1 + IPV, and IPV + 2S1) and the control groups (PBS and pVAX1) (**, P 0.01). titers for 2S1 + IPV were higher than those for S1 and IPV + 2S1. no serum neutralizing antibody responses could be detected within the 6-week period in mice immunized with either the PBS or the pVAX1 control. the levels of IgG2b, IgG3 and IgA antibodies were low in the sera of mice immunized with different PHE-CoV vaccines. the levels of anti-PHE-CoV IgG2a and IgG1 were significantly different from those in the control groups. viral RNA was undetectable in the brain homogenates of mice vaccinated with IPV or 2S1 + IPV. the protective effect was the same as that with IPV. for both the PBS and pVAX1 control groups, PHE-CoV RNA was detectable in the brain homogenates of mice. mice immunized with inactivated PHE-CoV plus alum induced stronger proliferation response than mice immunized with inactivated PHE-CoV only (IP group) the OD value of the 2S1 + IPV group increased slightly compared with that of the IPV + 2S1 group (*, P 0.05) percentages of CD4+ cells in mice immunized with IPV (inactivated PHE-CoV plus alum), IP (inactivated PHE-CoV alone), S1 (pVAX1-S1), 2S1 + IPV (plasmid pVAX1-S1 and inactivated PHE-CoV plus alum and plasmid pVAX1-S1) increased significantly over those in mice immunized with either the PBS or the frequencies of cells producing IL-2, IL-4, TNF-, and IFN- at the single-cell level were determined using an ELISPOT assay. both IPV and S1 could induce the production of all four of the cytokines tested in mice. the control groups showed only low numbers of nonspecific spots. DISCUSSION Pigs are the only species known to be naturally susceptible to PHE-CoV infection. most of the infections in this species are subclinical, and the overall economic impact of the disease is low. the development of safe, high-performance vaccines for the prevention and treatment of PHE-CoV has important practical significance. the immunization protocols were used to evaluate the ability of the vaccines to induce serum neutralizing antibodies and cellular immune responses. the addition of alum to the IPV preparation was found to increase the serum VN activity significantly. the addition of alum to inactivated PHE-CoV increased the time over which the immune animals could effectively stimulate a humoral immune response. previous studies have shown that the protective effect of DNA vaccines is not dependent on higher doses but that immune boosters designed to improve the antigen expression level could induce a high level of antibody response. combined immunization groups are generally divided into cytotoxic T (Tc) cells, suppressor T (Ts) cells, delayed-type hypersensitivity T (TD) cells, and helper/inducer T (Th) cells. the distribution of CD4+ on the Th cell surface can increase the number of memory cells. cytokines divide the T cells into Th1 and Th2 cell subsets. the main role of these cytokines is to promote antibody production. the IPV group induced mainly IL-4 and did so at a higher level than the IP group. al and cellular immune responses are known to contribute to protection against coronavirus infection (26), though T cells may also play a role in exacerbating the pathology of some animal coronavirus infections (35). mice that were vaccinated twice with DNA vaccines and were then boosted with IPV could activate both B and T cells to induce specific humoral and cellular immune responses.
